content: The group evaluates use of OMOP and Atlas to export as a FHIR-CQL query to retrieve data for measurement and analysis for digital quality measures (dQMs). Participants have been joining meetings of the Clinical Quality Information HL7 Workgroup on Wednesdays at 10 AM ET (every other Wednesday. The next calls are Wednesday December 22, then Wednesday January 5. Information published at: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/CQIWC/OMOP+-+dQM+Calls+-+CQI. Also, CQI WG has scheduled Thursday, Q1 (January 20) for those attending the January HL7 Working Group Meeting.
The December 22 FHIR + OMOP dQM call is cancelled due to limited participation. The next call will be January 5, 2022 at 10 AM ET.
I'm interested in seeing where this discussion is leading - not for the mapping itself, but for the metamodel.
So, first question, after reading some of the materials - is there a metamodel in place, or being planned?

in case we don't or in case it's not clear what I mean with metamodel (sorry if this is trivial for the participants here), here's a (incomplete) example:
image.png
@Floyd Eisenberg , do we have this meeting today? I tried with the Zoom link posted in the Confluence, but it kept saying "wait for the host to start the this meeting"
I suspect it was cancelled due to HL7 WGM. We cancelled today’s DMH subgroup call for that reason

Ben Smith said:

I suspect it was cancelled due to HL7 WGM. We cancelled today’s DMH subgroup call for that reason

Thank you, Ben.
Sorry - this meeting was canceled for today. I thought I canceled it in the HL7 schedule. Sorry for the confusion.

@Floyd Eisenberg , do we have this meeting tomorrow (3/23rd)? If yes, Jack Brewster from IQVIA would like do a quick demo to show how to import VSAC into Atlas automatically using R packages. The demo can be as short as 5 - 10 minutes.

Yes, we have a meeting and the demo would be terrific. Thank you

Sent from my iPhone
